body_html:
If you can write the SVM layer as a composition of simple ops, inputs, and Variables, i suggest putting it in tf.contrib.layers. How much C++ code does it require?
…
On Tue, Apr 18, 2017 at 9:32 AM, Xiangchun Li ***@***.***> wrote: @petrosmol <https://github.com/petrosmol> @drpngx <https://github.com/drpngx> there is already an implementation of SVM output layer <apache/incubator-mxnet@7a651fd> in MxNet. It may be useful for similar implementation in tensorflow. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. does it require?

body:
If you can write the SVM layer as a composition of simple ops, inputs, and
Variables, i suggest putting it in tf.contrib.layers.  How much C++ code
does it require?

On Tue, Apr 18, 2017 at 9:32 AM, Xiangchun Li <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @petrosmol <https://github.com/petrosmol> @drpngx
> <https://github.com/drpngx> there is already an implementation of SVM
> output layer
> <https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/2708/commits/7a651fd2867e56ffcbf539aaaf4218e11cf61b0d>
> in MxNet. It may be useful for similar implementation in tensorflow.
>
> —
